protocol_name: Th1 Polarization of Mouse CD4+ Cells
protocol_name_html: Th1 Polarization of Mouse CD4+ Cells

materials.reagent_name: LEAF™ Purified anti-mouse IL-4 Antibody, clone 11B11
Ionomycin calcium salt from Streptomyces conglobatus

guidelines:
Reagent List:

 

  • Sterile PBS
  • Cell culture medium (RPMI 1640 supplemented with 10% FBS)
  • Sterile 12-well plate
  • Sterile 6-well plate
  • RBC Lysis Buffer (Cat. No. 420301)
  • Anti-mouse CD3ε, clone 145-2C11 (LEAF™ format, Cat. No. 100314)
  • Anti-mouse CD28, clone 37.51, (LEAF™ format, Cat. No. 102112)
  • Anti-mouse IL-4, clone 11B11, (LEAF™ format, Cat. No. 504108)
  • Recombinant mouse IL-2 (carrier-free) (Cat. No. 575402)
  • Recombinant mouse IL-12 (p70) (carrier-free) (Cat. No. 577002)
  • Monensin Solution (Cat. No. 420701)
  • PMA (Phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate) (Cat. No. P8139 from Sigma)
  • Ionomycin (Cat. No. I0634 from Sigma)

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"f99ga","text":"Harvest lymph nodes (superficial cervical, mandibular, axillary, inguinal, and mesenteric) from mice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
steps.section: Isolation of CD4+ Cells From Lymph Nodes

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"9q8um","text":"Tease lymph nodes through a sterile 70-\u00b5m nylon cell strainer to obtain single-cell suspensions incomplete RPMI containing 10% FCS (complete medium).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
steps.section: Isolation of CD4+ Cells From Lymph Nodes

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"3shjc","text":"Resuspend cells in complete medium and use your favorite method to isolate CD4+cells. Consider using our Mojosort\u2122 Mouse CD4 T Cell Isolation Kit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":78,"length":1,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"B807DCB9FF874AFB814657E8E2396EAE","id":664650,"previous_id":664649,"previous_guid":"F05FF2EA4A784FB2B9ACB2DB08434DD9","section":"Isolation of CD4+ Cells From Lymph Nodes"}
steps.section: Isolation of CD4+ Cells From Lymph Nodes

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"3a44a","text":"On day 0, coat 12-well plate with anti-mouse CD3\u03b5, clone 145-2C11 (3\u00b5g\/ml). Incubate at 37\u00b0C for 2 hours or 4\u00b0C overnight. Aseptically decant antibody solution from the plate. Wash plate 3 times with sterile PBS. Discard liquid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eb7at","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"d59j4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"11t0b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"BBE318F0B85A11E8AB2D390475E22DE9","duration":7200,"label":"","step_guid":"5911B73882914636B6A2298F78A52D0E"}}],"guid":"5911B73882914636B6A2298F78A52D0E","id":664651,"previous_id":664650,"previous_guid":"B807DCB9FF874AFB814657E8E2396EAE","section":"Th1 Polarization of CD4+ Cells"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"14bac","text":"Plate CD4+ cells at 1.0 x 106 \/1ml\/well. Culture cells for 5 days at 37\u00b0C, 5% CO2, in the presence of anti-mouse CD28, clone 37.51 (3 \u00b5g\/mL), anti-mouse IL-4, clone 11B11 (10 \u00b5g\/mL), recombinant mouse IL-2 (5 ng\/mL), and recombinant mouse IL-12 (10 ng\/ml).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":9,"length":1,"style":"sup"},{"offset":28,"length":1,"style":"sup"},{"offset":80,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"7E734237BB0043958FBA89CAB9D5342B","id":664657,"previous_id":664656,"previous_guid":"5911B73882914636B6A2298F78A52D0E","section":"Th1 Polarization of CD4+ Cells"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d7tj2","text":"On day 3, if media is yellow, add 2 ml\/well of fresh media.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"F4E0CA46C349494C9785FBC653B4C14C","id":664658,"previous_id":664657,"previous_guid":"7E734237BB0043958FBA89CAB9D5342B","section":"Th1 Polarization of CD4+ Cells"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6qv6s","text":"After harvesting, the cells are ready for staining.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"C1272F8CCA5F46F09F3C3EC367675E02","id":664659,"previous_id":664660,"previous_guid":"2EF3AE8B394544058926B27460E9FF8B","section":"Th1 Polarization of CD4+ Cells"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6sqot","text":"On day 5, wash cells once and then restimulate in complete media with 50 ng\/ml PMA, 1 \u03bcg\/ml ionomycin and 10 \u00b5l monensin (1000x), in a 6-well plate in incubator at 37\u00b0C for 5 hours.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6nd8b","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"19490","duration":"18000","label":"","guid":"E2F68B789EA84B36B060BF7E6916022F"}}],"guid":"2EF3AE8B394544058926B27460E9FF8B","id":664660,"previous_id":664658,"previous_guid":"F4E0CA46C349494C9785FBC653B4C14C","section":"Th1 Polarization of CD4+ Cells"}
